sudoku

Class SudokuChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • sudoku.SudokuChecker

  • public class SudokuChecker
extends java.lang.Object
    The SudokuChecker class is used to check the correctness of the selected cell and if the user resolved the sudoku by comparing user values and the solver values
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Cudelcu Valentin Emil

      • isResolved

        public boolean isResolved()
        Checks if user resolved the sudoku
        Returns:
        TRUE if the sudoku is resolved, otherwise FALSE

      • isFilled

        public boolean isFilled(int row,
                        int col)
        Used in the createValidSudoku method of SudokuSolver Class to check if all the cells are filled
        Parameters:
        row - - row index of the cell
        col - - col index of the cell
        Returns:
        TRUE if table is filled
        See Also:
        SudokuSolver.createValidSudoku(int, int)

      • isSafe

        public boolean isSafe(int[][] values,
                      int row,
                      int col,
                      int num)
        Checks if the value already exists in the row, col or 3x3 box
        Parameters:
        values - - array with current values
        row - - row index of the cell
        col - - col index of the cell
        num - - number to check
        Returns:
        TRUE if every condition passed, otherwise FALSE
